explanation (cot): Oncotic pressure is higher in the capillaries, not less. Refer Ganong 24/e, p 343

Anterograde axonal transport moves materials from the cell body to the axon terminal. Retrograde axonal transport moves materials from the axon terminal to the cell body. Refer Basic Pathology, 10/e. p. 54
Insulin promotes glycogen synthesis, inhibits glycogen breakdown, decreases gluconeogenesis, and limits ketogenesis. Refer Basic Pathology, 10/e. p. 87
Tropicamide concentration is typically 0.5%. Refer Comprehensive Ophthalmology, 4/e. p. 1020
Category B for H1N1 influenza includes pregnant women with sore throat who can start oseltamivir without immediate testing. Refer Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 20/e. p. 1970
Kiesselbach's plexus receives blood supply from branches of the internal maxillary artery, not external carotid artery. Refer Netter's Head and Neck Anatomy for Dentistry, 2/e. p. 101
Electrical alternans is a regular alternation of the QRS complex amplitude and morphology seen in conditions like pericardial effusion. Refer ECG Made Easy, 8/e. p. 84

Oligemic lung fields and a normal-sized heart suggest pulmonary atresia, where there is no communication between the pulmonary trunk and the right ventricle. Refer Nelson Textbook of Pediatrics, 21/e. p. 2145

Before performing the ABG, syringe should be loaded with 0.3 cc of heparin. Normal pH, HCO3, and PCO2 levels may not indicate absence of an acid-base imbalance. A different site should be tried if modified Allen's test is negative. Radial artery is the preferred site.
Respiratory rhythm generation center is located at Pre-Botzinger complex.
Gait apraxia is seen in thromboembolic episode involving ACA.
If a patient who was on a ventilator suddenly pulls out the endotracheal tube, the next step of management is to assess the patient, give bag and mask ventilation, and look for spontaneous breathing.
The characteristic of venous blood flow of the lower limb in duplex Doppler is biphasic.
2,3-BPG binds to sites of hemoglobin and the affinity for oxygen: 1, decreases.
The highest concentration of oxygen is delivered through a mask with a reservoir.
A mother who is Hbs Ag positive and anti-Hbe Ag positive has a 0% risk of transmission of Hep. B in the child.
In a patient with increased salivation, increased bronchial secretions, and hypotension, the treatment should be Atropine.
In a study comparing newborn weights based on maternal food supplements, the appropriate test to use is Student's T-test.
Vitamin B6 (PLP) is required for glycogen Phosphorylase.
The only complete cartilage ring in the respiratory tree is the cricoid cartilage.
